Key Match Events: Trent Boult became the first New Zealander and sixth overall to reach 50 wickets in World Cups.
Daryl Mitchell scored the fastest half-century in this World Cup and the joint second-fastest by a Sri Lankan in all World Cups.
Kusal Perera reached his half-century off just 22 balls, the fastest in this World Cup and the joint second-fastest by a Sri Lankan in all World Cups.
Pre-Game Insights: NZ won the toss and elected to bowl, citing the influence of weather on their decision.
NZ's four consecutive defeats didn't perturb Williamson; business as usual for NZ.
SL made one change, bringing Chamika Karunaratne in for Kasun Rajitha.
SL opted for a hit-the-deck option over a swing bowler.
SL captain Angelo Mathews was the first player in history to be timed out in an international match.
Post-Match Reflections: NZ won by 5 wickets with 160 balls remaining, lifting their NRR from 0.398 to 0.743.
If England get to 150, Pakistan will have to chase the target in 3.4 overs to usurp NZ's NRR.
Afghanistan need to win by 438 runs to go past NZ's NRR, which is considered highly unlikely.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Trent Boult's wicket for Pathum Nissanka was his 51st in World Cups, making him the first New Zealander and sixth overall to reach this milestone.
Mitchell Santner came away with 10-2-22-2, the second-most economical ten-over spell in this World Cup.
Sri Lanka's last-wicket stand of 43 was the highest in the innings and the highest tenth-wicket stand for SL in all World Cups.
Theekshana and Madushanka reached their career-best scores in ODI cricket.
Others: There was a bit of movement on offer due to overcast skies, and the white ball didn't swing much.
Rain had interrupted NZ's last game at the Chinnaswamy against Pakistan and their training sessions.
